Package mmj.lang

Class Var

java.lang.Object
mmj.lang.MObj
mmj.lang.Sym
mmj.lang.Var
Direct Known Subclasses:
WorkVar
public class Var extends Sym
Var holds a declared Metamath variable symbol.

A Metamath variable can be defined more than once if the $v statements occur within a Scope; outside of that scope the Var is "inactive" and cannot be referenced by subsequent Formula's. However, the "id" -- variable String -- cannot have been previously defined as that of a Cnst, and Cnst's must be defined in global scope. (In practice, Var's are defined globally because they have no meaning without a VarHyp -- a Var is just a "thing" with an identifying character String, just like a Cnst.)

Curiously, Var receives less coverage in mmj than Cnst. But perhaps that is explained by the fact that to be used in a Formula's Expression, a Var must not only be "active" (in scope), but there must be an active VarHyp for the Var, assigning it a Type Code (and Type Codes are Cnsts).

For convenience, a reference to the activeVarHyp for a Var is stored in var.

FYI, variables used in Syntax Axioms must be in "global scope", and they always have an activeVarHyp. mmj does not do anything with this factoid, but the potential exists to maintain a list of activeVarHyp's and Var's by Type Code... and the list would never be null for those Type Codes that are part of the grammar.

  • Method Details

    • declareVar

      public static Var declareVar(int seq, Map<String,Sym> symTbl, Map<String,Stmt> stmtTbl, String id) throws LangException
      Adds a new "active" Var to LogicalSystem.

      If the Var does not already exist in symTbl, it is added, otherwise, the existing Var is returned.

      If the Var symbol duplicates a Cnst symbol or if the Var is already "active", a LangException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      seq - MObj.seq number (discarded if Var already exists.)
      symTbl - Map containing all Syms.
      stmtTbl - Map containing all Stmts.
      id - String value (id) of the Var symbol.
      Returns:
      the new or already existing Var.
      Throws:
      LangException - if the Var symbol duplicates an existing Cnst symbol or if the Var is already "active" -- or if the Var symbol duplicates a Stmt label.

    • setActive

      public void setActive(boolean active)
      Marks a Var as "active" or "inactive".
      Parameters:
      active - set Sym true or false.

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Is Sym active?

      Cnsts are always active as they cannot be defined inside a scope level, but a Var defined in a non-global scope level is "inactive" outside of that scope.

      The question "is Sym 'x' active" has relevance only in relation to a Stmt: only "active" Syms can be used in a given Stmt's Formula.

      Specified by:
      isActive in class Sym
      Returns:
      is Sym "active"

    • setActiveVarHyp

      public void setActiveVarHyp(VarHyp activeVarHyp)
      Set the activeVarHyp for a Var (or null).

      For speed and convenience, an active Var maintains its current VarHyp; this saves having to do a difficult look-up :)

      Parameters:
      activeVarHyp - or null.

    • getActiveVarHyp

      public VarHyp getActiveVarHyp()
      Return the activeVarHyp for a Var.

      For speed and convenience, an active Var maintains its current VarHyp; this saves having to do a difficult look-up :)

      Returns:
      Returns Var.activeVarHyp (may be null).

    • getVarHyp

      public VarHyp getVarHyp(VarHyp[] varHypArray)
      Fetches the VarHyp for a Var given an VarHyp array.

      A tedious little routine to help our friend Formula.

      Parameters:
      varHypArray - array of VarHyp such as one would find in an Assrt or LogHyp.
      Returns:
      returns matching VarHyp or null if not found.
      See Also:
      • Formula

      public VarHyp getVarHyp(Hyp[] hypArray)

      A tedious little routine to help our friend Formula.

      Parameters:
      hypArray - array of Hyp such as one would find in a ScopeFrame.
      Returns:

    • verifyVarDefAndActive

      public static Var verifyVarDefAndActive(Map<String,Sym> symTbl, String varS) throws LangException
      Validates a variable's string (id) to make sure it is properly defined and active.

      If so, a reference to the existing Var is returned. Otherwise, LangException generated!

      Parameters:
      symTbl - Map of already defined Syms.
      varS - String identifying a variable.
      Returns:
      Var matching input String.
      Throws:
      LangException - thrown if variable is not defined, is defined as a constant, or is not active.

    • verifyVarDef

      public static Var verifyVarDef(Map<String,Sym> symTbl, String varS) throws LangException
      Validates a variable's string (id) to make sure it is properly defined.

      If so, a reference to the existing Var is returned. Otherwise, LangException generated!

      Parameters:
      symTbl - Map of already defined Syms.
      varS - String identifying a variable.
      Returns:
      Var matching input String.
      Throws:
      LangException - thrown if variable is not defined, is defined as a constant, or is not active.

    • accumVarListBySeq

      public void accumVarListBySeq(List<Var> varList)
      Accumulate var (no duplicates), storing it in an array list in order of appearance in the database.

      Because varList is maintained in database statement sequence order, hypList should either be empty (new) before the call, or already be in that order.

      Parameters:
      varList - List of Var's, updated here.

    • containedInVarListBySeq

      public boolean containedInVarListBySeq(List<Var> varList)
      Searches for this Var in an ArrayList maintained in database input sequence.
      Parameters:
      varList - List of Var's
      Returns:
      true if found, else false.
